intro: Campylanthus hubaishanii, commonly known as the Habaishan bellflower, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. The plant typically grows in rocky or mountainous regions, adapting to high-altitude environments. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that bloom in the summer. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
